website_summaries.verdict: A step by step guide to real-estate investment based on current market trends.
pros: Readers appreciate the modern day advice this book offers when it comes to real estate investing
Genuine and written in a manner that is not overly sales oriented
A must-read for landlords or those thinking of managing tenants
cons: We would love it if the author didn't mention his website so much as it detracts from the overall material

customer_reviews.title: Fluff
customer_reviews.text: The author states the obvious over and over as if he's speaking to an 8 year old. Lots quotes that were completely irrelevent and out of context, simply put there to fill the page and wow the reader. Author also recommends giving people bad deals and over-charging on rent so you can "live for free" - highly unethical in my opinion. The constant and obvious plugging of the webite and podcast also felt patronizing...we get the message the first time, was it really necessary to keep recommending it on every fourth page? Certainly some good information in there, however all the other stuff made it a tiresome read.
customer_reviews.author: Liam O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Free audiobook = scam
customer_reviews.text: The first page of the ebook claims a free audiobook is included, I followed the necessary steps exactly and no audiobook. Tried again, no go. I then contacted Bigger Pockets support who seemed very helpful at first, asking for the email to my account to verify. Since then I've emailed them multiple times for an answer even including my order number without so much as a reply back. The audiobook isn't expensive but the fact that it's offered for free at the start of the ebook and there is no way to get it is ridiculous. If the offer is no longer available I'd expect them to update the ebook. Very disappointed in BiggerPockets over this
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Great info
customer_reviews.text: I've read Rich Dad, Poor Dad. I got suckered into their seminar where I did not learn anything I didn't know from the book. This is better because the guy who wrote it is talking about NOW. RDPD was written DECADES before the 2007 crash. Yes, the principles are the same, but I feel Turner has better cautionary notes and advice. There's a chapter on buying in an expensive area, which is particularly necessary for where I live.
customer_reviews.author: anisa alamia

customer_reviews.title: This Book is PURE GOLD!

Every question I could possibly think of was answered in this book! Time to get out and take action!

customer_reviews.title: This book is excellent. It covers in-depth the basics and nuances of ...

My only criticism is that at times I feel as if I was being talked to like a child, but those moments were few and far between and it was all for the sake of clarity. Regardless, any person, whether new to investing or seasoned, should grab this book.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to the library, especially if you're starting out

I have bought half a dozen books, joined our local Real Estate investment groups, and started listening to Bigger Pockets podcast (In that order). If I had a guide, or anyone I could have asked, on how to get started, they would have said buy this book first! Read it cover to cover. Then get out there and start your journey. It lays out the "basic" (not simple, or easy) information everyone has to know in today's investor environment. It would have saved me thousands (no exaggeration) on my investments.

customer_reviews.title: Great book for beginners!

The only thing I wished he would have covered was how to properly calculate or do a short sale. Other than that this book definitely deserves 5 stars. Unlike other books that ramble about nothing, he actually provided a lot of beneficial information.

As for future improvements, maybe include some content on vacation rentals and how much you can use the property for personal use. Highly recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Great book- the cover seems bland, but the book is a must!
customer_reviews.text: Great Book! Very practical stuff. I found myself taking notes and reading parts over again. Not because it was a diffcult read, but because I was so engaged and wanted to read it again. LOL. Whether you want to acquire a few rentals or build an empire, this book should will show you a path. Brandon's a knowledgeable guy and I enjoy reading his books. Practical. Applicable. Precise. This book delivers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth money and time you will spend.
customer_reviews.text: Took almost 2 weeks to read ( evenings. After work). Everything is explained and easy to understand. Very good tool to have in your tool bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Book - I couldn't put it down!
customer_reviews.text: This was a good book. I am researching to start investing in rental property and I think this was a great start for me to read this book. I was hooked from chapter one. Ii really made me feel comfortable in starting the new journey for my family. It was easy to follow along. I would definitely recommend buying this book.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy C.

customer_reviews.title: Great book for starting your real estate investment career
customer_reviews.text: Loved this book. Covered many points on real estate investing and gave many great examples of the subjects covered. The author wasn’t trying to sell more products to you. The author explained everything in detail and he isn’t some rich millionaire boasting about his product. I recommend this book to anyone starting on their real estate investing career.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Must Read, especially for the beginner
customer_reviews.text: As a newbie getting into real estate investing and not rushing into it this book was excellent. Although not inclusive to include everything in real estate it really did cover the basics and I learned a great deal. I could not put it down and am reading it for second time. The author even states this is a boon to refer back to. If a newbie like me who wants to learn the trade, but at the same time is not rushing in where mistakes could end a deal or ruin the motivation I highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great book that will give you a broad knowlege of RE Rentals
customer_reviews.text: This book is great to for beginners and above to gain a significant amount of knowlege to help you get in to serious in vesting. Brandon is someone that wrote this book while he is on the journey of investing, making it easier for beginers to relate to. This book is presented through BiggerPockets so you will hear about it often, at the beginning I thought of it as an advertisment scheme, though I later relized it is a very useful site so check it out!! Thanks Brandon!
customer_reviews.author: Sholom Meisels

customer_reviews.title: A good, basic introduction
customer_reviews.text: A good, basic introduction. Lots of padding; Not a lot of substance beyond what is available online or in other basic primers. The writing is OK.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Provides a lot of Knowledge!
customer_reviews.text: Since being new to the real estate industry and investing field, I searched and read multiple reviews trying to find a book that would provide me with as much knowledge as possible on rental property investing. I have to say I’m very pleased with my purchase of this book. I told my husband just the other day this book will be the one I always go back to reference from.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great step by step process of the various acts of managing rental properties. It's not a "get rich quick scheme," but provides actionable steps to begin building long term wealth through real estate. Everything Brandon Turner and Bigger Pockets puts out is phenomenal. I highly encourage you to check them out!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon G

customer_reviews.title: Great book for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Perfect book for beginners. Walks you through everything you need to know to close on your first deal. Practical experience will never be replaced by a book but you will avoid many mistakes in real estate when you pay attention reading through it.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good book for me being new to the ins and outs of rentals properties. Would absolutely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: You guys nailed it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely incredible book. Clearly a very well thought out book written for the everyday person. I placed a ton of bookmarks in the one for reference down the road. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book
customer_reviews.text: Packed with info for the future real estate investor - with a focus on buy and hold real estate rentals. Great width with decent depth
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Book To Get Started
customer_reviews.text: It's a great book to inspire you and get you started. The first few chapters are "you can do it!" inspiration, but the remainder of the book does a good job of explaining rental property investing.
customer_reviews.author: Raj Kissoon

customer_reviews.title: a must buy for new investors
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on investing in long-term rentals this is a must read. Brabdon is one of the best real estate authors put there. Do yourself a favor and hit that buy button!
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: I definitely have a new perspective om investing in rental properties. Its not as complicated and cumbersome as I thought. The author breaks down everything in layman's terms so it is much easier to grasp. This is a good book to read and learn the basics of getting into rental property investments. Loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Cherished

customer_reviews.title: Good how to guide. Too much fluff
customer_reviews.text: Good content, great PRACTICAL guide (how to). Downside: just too much fluff. A lot of sentences include things like "As I was sitting in a Chinese all you can eat restaurant bla bla" Simply cutting out these things should shorted the book by about one third without losing any content. I had no trouble downloading the free e-book that comes with this purchase (Great plus)
customer_reviews.author: D. Arrindell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a newbie investor, i know real estate investment can be really risky if you don’t educate yourself well first. So after searching many books and based on reviews, I chose this book, I’m so glad I read this book, it’s very well written and teach you step by step, such as teach you how to analyze rental properties, and negotiating and property management and so on. Its a complete full picture of rental investment step by step!! I highly recommend everyone especially newbie investors ready this book!! Thank you Brandon!!!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent primer on the entire process
customer_reviews.text: This books touched on everything from looking for a property to disposing of it and everything in between. I was impressed by the breath of topics as well as the depth on certain ideas. A perfect read for those just starting (or thinking of starting) in the rental property investing game.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great first book to read for a new Real Estate investor
customer_reviews.text: So many books are full of garbage marketing materials. This is a great first book to read if you want to get into real estate investing (passive income, flipping, etc). I'll be reading it a second time to take notes.
customer_reviews.author: Carnet

customer_reviews.title: Very insightful
customer_reviews.text: A recommended read for anyone interested in rental property investing. Easy to read and follow. Brandon does a great job guiding you through the obstacles and pitfalls along the way. A call to action is a big take away. Stop dreaming and start doing. Give this a read and get to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very informative book
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this book, it help me gain great knowledge on real estate investing. Brandon turner offered advice, scenarios, and defined terms I desired to learn and now I feel more capable of entering into the realm of real estate investing. This is only the beginning as I also learn from Biggerpockets community which he mentions in the book. I recommend reading this book!
customer_reviews.author: Sieanna

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic read
customer_reviews.text: The book flows so perfectly. Each chapter encompasses and transitions well into the next chapter. I wasn't able to put the book down once I picked it up. Looking forward to a second read, and this time with a highlighter and a serious plan of action in place. Thanks for the great content and outlining every aspect in detail.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strategies Won't Apply EVERYWHERE, but Good Read!
customer_reviews.text: Easy read with some good strategies, some of which would be much harder to pull off in the more expensive areas of the country. All in all there is sound advice!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Petsche

customer_reviews.title: Good advice
customer_reviews.text: I like that fact that the author highlighted both pros n cons in each situation. This book gives some valuable Adi ice in managing properties and calculating cash flow. Some parts are more useful if you resides in the U.S. I stay in Singapore so the real estate here is pretty diff. Still I appreciate the advices and insights.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the read
customer_reviews.text: This book contains great information on investing in rental property. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: C. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Not for advanced Real estate investors
customer_reviews.text: If you have gone through 2-3 Real estate transactions than most of the stuff in this book will be common sense.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the read for newbies!
customer_reviews.text: I'm completely new to real estate investing. I hope to purchase a property within the next 6 months. This book has provided the foundation for with everything I need to accomplish my first purchase.. It will be a great reference moving forward. I'm active in the bigger pockets forums, and look forward to real action in real estate investing.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Organized & Comprehensive, but Add an Index!!
customer_reviews.text: The book on rental property investing by Brandon Turner is one of my favorites. That book is so organized, to the point, comprehensive, and is full of great content. I keep referencing back to it as I go through this process. Con: I just wish it had an index!!
customer_reviews.author: Lance J. Mccaskill

customer_reviews.title: So glad I chose this book!
customer_reviews.text: A must read if you are considering getting into real estate investing. Provides clear and concise information. There were a lot of books to choose from on Amazon, but I am so glad I chose this book! I do wish they had a book for Canadians, but even so, most of the material is appropriate. The taxes is one key element that differs, so I need to find another book on that.
customer_reviews.author: K.H.
